did.unittitle: John Richards Collection of NYU Photographs and Negatives

physdesc.extent: in 1 manuscript box and a half manuscript box

did.abstract: The John Richards Collection of NYU Photographs and Negatives (circa 1890-1933) consists of photographs and glass plate negatives documenting New York University's University Heights campus and Washington Square area. Materials in this collection were purchased from John Richards in 1938.
did.langmaterial: The materials in this collection are in English.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged by NYU campus and then by building.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The John Richards Collection of NYU Photographs and Negatives (circa 1890-1933) consists of photographs documenting New York University's University Heights campus. There are also photographs of the Washington Square area. Majority of the photographs depict buildings and the campus, but there are also some photographs of people.

This collection contains 13 glass plate negatives that mainly focus on Washington Square, including University buildings. There are also glass plate negatives taken by D.W. Hering of the Andrew H. Green plaque.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials in this collection were transferred from the New York University Archives Photograph Collection (PHOTO 00001) in May 2024. The accession number associated with this collection is 2024.043.
Materials in this collection were purchased from John Richards in 1938.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: In May 2024, John Richards's photographs and glass plate negatives were removed from the New York University Archives Photograph Collection (PHOTO 00001) and made into a new collection, MC 399. Materials were rehoused in acid-free boxes and folders. Original titles were retained. Glass plate negatives were transferred to New York University's Barbara Goldsmith Preservation and Conservation Department for stabilization and rehousing. Materials were described on the collection-level and inventoried at the file-level.
